page.title: 06Landford lodge
page.content: Landford lodge was built in 1776 as a hunting lodge by Sir William Heathcote.Breach house was there before Landford Lodge and it was owned by George Stokes.Mr.Dodington Egerton bought it off Mr.Stokes,and sold it to Sir Heathcote.In 1787 Mr. Spooner bought it.Then Mr.Spooner sold it to Samuel Greatheed who lived there,and his son built on a kitchen and a wing at the back.In 1846 Landford Lodge was rented to Josiah Wedgewood who was the son of the Staffordshire Potter,and he rented it for three hundred pounds a year.In 1848 Countess Nelson bought it and Whitehouse farm.In 1865 Mr.Wigram bought it .In 1920 he sold it to the Bulloch family.Fifteen years later J.G.Stuart rented it and the army made camps in the grounds.Then in 1947 Peter Pleydell Bouverie bought it and sold it to Christopher Pilkington.
